description: The acquisition of 510 electric leg systems for the conversion of workstations in Building 3, Carling Campus, Ottawa, Ontario to support the Treasury Board Secretariat's Return to Office initiative. The selected contractor will extract the existing support systems of the desks, dismantle the current leg support settings, install the new electric leg system, and provide a space suitable for a minimum of 510 high-density workstations.Each workstation will include   electric legs, monitors, and space for employees' computing equipment. It is expected that the work will be completed by February 23, 2024.

full_summary:
# Electric Leg Systems Tender Announcement
## Publisher’s Note
This tender announcement is subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the relevant government documents and policies.

## Tender Details

* **Title**: Procurement of Electric Leg Systems for Hybrid Return to Office at Carling Campus
* **Reference Number**: CB-258-68869459
* **Amendment Number**: 6
* **Solicitation Number**: 2023-MSO-008
* **Publication Date**: 2023-12-04
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-01-09 14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2024-02-23

## Description and Scope of Work

The Department of National Defence (DND) and the Assistant Deputy Minister (HR-Civ) are seeking to procure 510 electric leg systems for use by HR-Civ employees at the Carling Campus. The successful bidder will be responsible for delivering, assembling, and installing the electric leg systems, removing the existing leg support and disposing of the collateral materials.

## Location of Work and Schedule

* **Location**: 60 Moodie Drive, Ottawa, Ontario, Building 3, 1st Floor, Collaborative Space
* **Scheduling**: The bidder is expected to submit a detailed schedule of work upon request. The electric leg systems must be delivered, assembled, and installed by 2024-02-23.

## Evaluation Methodology and Contract Overview

The bid will be evaluated on the basis of the mandatory technical criteria, including the bidder’s ability to meet the scope of work, deliver the electric leg systems on time, and provide a comprehensive plan for the disposal of collateral materials. The successful bidder will be required to sign a contract outlining the terms and conditions of the procurement.

## Agency Contact Information

* **Point of Contact**: Trina Gaumond
* **Contact Information**: Trina Gaumond
*Email:**trina.gaumond2@forces.gc.ca
*Phone**: (418) 809-8827
*Fax**: Not available
*Address**: 25 Grand Bernier South, Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu, QC
*Country**: Canada
## Note
Please note that the notice is available on the Canada Buy Service website. All bid documents are available for download from this website.
